entry.title: Creating a more comprehensive dependency graph with build time detection
entry.summary: Expand the completeness of your dependency graph by using the dependency submission API, which will create more comprehensive alerts on supply chain vulnerabilities

entry.title: Release Radar · May 2022 Edition
entry.summary: Each month, we highlight open source projects that have shipped major updates. These projects can include everything from world-changing technology to developer tooling, and weekend hobbies. We cover what the project is and some of their breaking changes. Read about the project, and browse their repositories. Without further ado, here are our top staff picks […]

entry.title: The Android kernel mitigations obstacle race
entry.summary: In this post I’ll exploit CVE-2022-22057, a use-after-free in the Qualcomm gpu kernel driver, to gain root and disable SELinux from the untrusted app sandbox on a Samsung Z flip 3. I’ll look at various mitigations that are implemented on modern Android devices and how they affect the exploit.

entry.title: Git Merge 2022
entry.summary: Git Merge, the conference dedicated to bringing the Git community together returns on September 14-15 in Chicago, Illinois.

entry.title: Prebuilding codespaces is generally available
entry.summary: Teams and GHEC customers can now create blazing fast codespaces, even for your largest and most complex projects.

entry.title: GitHub now publishes malware advisories in the GitHub Advisory Database
entry.summary: To combat the prevalence of malware in the open source ecosystem, GitHub now publishes malware occurrences in the GitHub Advisory Database. These advisories power Dependabot alerts and remain forever free and usable by the community.

entry.title: Accelerating GitHub theme creation with color tooling
entry.summary: Learn why the GitHub Design Infrastructure team built a dedicated color tool and how they use it to create new color palettes for GitHub.

entry.title: How can the United States build its Open Source Software policy?
entry.summary: We share a recap of a recent roundtable event about what a federal open source software policy could look like in the United States.

entry.title: Open Source Monthly: June 2022 Edition
entry.summary: June's Open Source Monthly features Modos–a community-focused company building software and hardware that designs digital devices with respect for users' time, attention, and well-being.

entry.title: Implementing a robust digital identity
entry.summary: How can you robustly assert and identify a user’s identity?
